content.title: Warfarin Anticoagulation
content.definition: Vitamin K antagonist anticoagulant used for prevention and treatment of thromboembolic disorders.

concepts.definition: Inhibits vitamin K epoxide reductase, preventing gamma-carboxylation of factors II, VII, IX, and X.

clinical_features.onset: Full effect 5-7 days due to factor half-lives

concepts.definition: International Normalized Ratio for standardized warfarin monitoring.
Extensive interactions affecting warfarin metabolism and vitamin K availability.
Strategies for reversing warfarin anticoagulation in bleeding or urgent surgery.

vitamin_k.oral: 2.5-5 mg for elevated INR without bleeding

clinical_features.bridge_therapy: LMWH or UFH during initiation until INR therapeutic
clinical_features.perioperative: Hold 5 days pre-procedure for most surgeries

content.statement: Warfarin Anticoagulation is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pharmacology that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
